titleStmt.title: An answer to the Hertford letter; in a dialogue between a Quaker and his neighbour, concerning the murther of Mrs. Sarah Stout.
Dialogue between a Quaker and his neighbour in Hertford, about the murder of Mrs. Sarah Stout

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for the author, and sold by the book-sellers of London and Westminster,

notesStmt.note: Another edition of: A dialogue between a Quaker and his neighbour in Hertford, about the murder of Mrs. Sarah Stout.
Anonymous argument, in the form of a dialogue, that seeks to demonstrate that Stout did not commit suicide as some alleged, but was murdered. Includes the report of those who conducted the autopsy.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
